meanings.sent1: The dinks of rain on the roof were soothing.
meanings.sent2: I heard the dinks of coins dropping into the jar.
meanings.sent3: The dinks of the tiny bells on the cat's collar made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The dinks of the distant chimes filled the air with magic.
meanings.sent5: The dinks of the wind chimes created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a foolish or silly person
meanings.sent1: Don't be a dinks and listen to your parents.
meanings.sent2: He always acts like a dinks in front of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The class clown was known for being a lovable dinks.
meanings.sent4: She teased him affectionately, calling him a playful dinks.
meanings.sent5: Being a dinks sometimes can make people laugh.

meanings.sent1: She dinks the ball with precision during the game.
meanings.sent2: He dinks the keys on the piano softly to create a melody.
meanings.sent3: The toddler dinks the toy drum with joyous enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The chef dinks the garnish onto the dish with finesse.
meanings.sent5: He dinks the nail into the wall to hang the picture.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a drink or beverage
meanings.sent1: Let's grab a dinks at the cafe after work.
meanings.sent2: She ordered a refreshing dinks to cool off in the heat.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively with everyone enjoying their favorite dinks.
meanings.sent4: He sipped his dinks slowly, savoring the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The bartender mixed a special dinks for the celebration.
